bug.short_desc: add @NonNull annotations to API/SPI classes relevant for connector developers

long_desc.thetext:
JDT now has support for @NonNull / @Nullable annotations which help to detect potential null pointer access [1]. These annotations are used by popular libraries and would be valuable to have in the tasks API to communicate to extenders where to potentially expect null.
[1] http://help.eclipse.org/juno/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.jdt.doc.user%2Ftasks%2Ftask-using_null_annotations.htm

The JDT annotations bundle has been added to the targets: https://git.eclipse.org/r/13790
These are the initial changes to add the annotations to the connector and settings page classes:
https://git.eclipse.org/r/13797 https://git.eclipse.org/r/13820
I also back-ported the target change to the 3.9.x branch so we can consume reviews 2.0.1 in the master build: https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14010/

From the review:
As much as I wish we could annotate all monitors with @NonNull it's not consistently the case so we should mark them all as @Nullable to be safe and ensure that implementations of abstract classes handle that case appropriately.

Formatter settings update:
https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14291 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14290 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14289 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14288 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14287 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14286 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14285 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14284 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14283
Pushed a review for TaskAttributeMapper: https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14478/.
Annotations have been added to key SPI classes. We can open another bug to cover additional classes.
